Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if all the above operations have the expected effect and no exception is thrown.

Test.name: Already registered
Test.WhatTest: Test that registering an already registered agent results in receiving a FAILURE message.
Test.HowWorkTest: A DFD is registered with the DF. Then the same DFD is registered again
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if a FAILURE message indicating already-registered as the failure reason is received from the DF

Test.name: Registration from remote platform
Test.WhatTest: Tests accessing the DF agent by an agent living on a remote platform.
Test.HowWorkTest: In the load phase a remote platform is started with an agent on it. Another container with the IIOP MTP is also started in the local platform to enable inter-platform communication. In the actual test the agent on the remote platform i) waits for a startup message from the tester ii) registers with the DF of the local platform iii) waits for a continuation message from the tester and iv) deregisters with the df. The tester agent searches the DF after the registration and the de-registration
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if the 2 searches result in finding the remote agent and finding no agent respectively.

Test.name: DF Lease Time
Test.WhatTest: Tests lease time functionality of the DF agent.
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if all the above operations have the expected effect and no exception is thrown.

Test.name: Registration renewal
Test.WhatTest: Tests the renewal of a registration by means of the keepRegistered() method.
Test.HowWorkTest:
Load phase: Kill the DF and restarts it on the same container with a properties file setting a maximum lease time of 20 secs.
Actual test: Create an agent that will register with the DF for 40 secs using the keepRegistered() method.
In parallel, search the DF after 5, 15, 25, 35 and 45 secs.
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if search 1, 2, 3 and 4 find 1 agent while search 5 finds no agent.

Test.name: Serializable property

Test.name: Fedaration
Test.WhatTest: Tests DF federation and recursive search on federated DF.

UL.LI: Create another DF agent called DF1
Register the 2nd with the default DF too
Request DF1 to federate with the default DF
Searches the default DF specifying maxDepth == 1 (should search DF1 too) and maxResults == -1 (should return all items found)

Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if the search produces 3 results and no exception is thrown.

Test.name: Recursive Search
Test.WhatTest:
Test recursive search perfomed on a federation of DFs. The parameters tested are max-depth, max-result as defined in: Fipa Agent Management Specification - SC00023J.
Note that to execute this test you have to the package jade.misc in classpath as it makes use of the DFFedarator agent. (..\jade\add-ons\misc).
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if the different queires obtain the expected results and no exception is thrown.
Test.Argument: The classpath where to find the DFFederator agent (included in the misc add-on)

Test.name: Search Until Found
Test.WhatTest: Tests the searchUntilFound() method of the DFService class.
Test.HowWorkTest:
The test performs the following operations:
registers DFD1 with the DF
launches another agent that will register a DFD2 after 5 sec and DFD12 after other 10 sec
calls searchUntilFound(template1 matching DFD1) (this should immediately return DFD1)
calls searchUntilFound(template2 matching DFD2) (this should return DFD2 as soos as the other agent registers DFD2);
calls searchUntilFound(template3 not matching, timeout == 5 sec) (this should return null when the timeout expires);
waits some time to check that no further notifications are received from the DF.
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if all the above operations have the expected effect and no exception is thrown.

Test.name: DF Subscription
Test.WhatTest: Tests the subscription service supported by the JADE DF.

UL.LI: register a DFD with the DF
subscribe to the DF (should immediately get back a notification);
After 5 sec register 2nd DFD (matching) with the DF (should get back another notification;
After 10 sec register 3rd DFD (not matching) with the DF (should not get back anything;
After 15 sec modify 2nd DFD (still matching) with the DF (should get back another notification;
After 20 sec modify 3rd DFD (now matching) with the DF (should get back another notification;

Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if all the above operations have the expected effect and no exception is thrown.

Test.name: Multiple Subscriptions
Test.WhatTest: Tests the case in which 2 or more agents subscribed to the DF.
Test.HowWorkTest:
Load phase Launches 3 agents that subscribe to the DF to receive notifications.
Actual test Registers a DFD matching the template specified by the subscribed agents. Then waits for INFORM messages from the subscribed agents who are expected to forward to the tester agent the notifications they receive from the DF.
Test.WhenTestPass: The test passes if the tester agent gets an INFORM message from each subscriber within a 10 sec.timeout.
